alert.note: Alert for Banner; Cheyenne; Kimball; Morrill; Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 05 at 1:54PM CST until January 06 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches with locally higher amounts possible in Banner and Kimball counties. Wind chills as low as minus 20 degrees. * WHERE...Southern Nebraska Panhandle including Scottsbluff, Harrisburg, Bridgeport, Kimball, and Sidney. This includes Interstate 80 from Pine Bluffs to Sidney. The heaviest snow is expected to fall across Banner and Kimball counties. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and significantly reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Dangerously cold wind chills could lead to frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Banner; Cheyenne; Kimball; Morrill; Scotts Bluff
